refnamediv.refpurpose: start ttylogin@.service services on (active) kernel virtual terminals

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: ttylogin-starter automatically runs system-control1 to start a ttylogin@.service service on each kernel virtual terminal. It is not applicable to user-space virtual terminals.
If the services do not exist, it makes no attempt to create them. To control what virtual terminals have auto-started ttylogin@.service services, simply create such services only as appropriate.

refsection.title: BSD BEHAVIOUR
refsection.para: On BSD operating systems it simply and unconditionally starts services for all 16 virtual terminals from ttyv0 to ttyvf.

refsection.title: LINUX BEHAVIOUR
refsection.para: On Linux, it monitors the state of the /sys/class/tty/tty0/active file with poll2. This file reports the currently active kernel virtual terminal name. Each time that poll2 reports a change in the currently active virtual terminal, ttylogin-starter issues a system-control reset command.
Alternative sysfs class names and "0th" TTY names, which combine to produce the aforementioned filename, can be specified with the --class and --tty command options, respectively.
